meanings.definition: To be excessively afraid or anxious about something.
meanings.sent1: She was overfearing the dark hallway, imagining all sorts of scary things lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overfear when faced with new challenges, but he always manages to overcome his fears.
meanings.sent3: The cat was overfearing the vacuum cleaner, convinced it was a monster in disguise.
meanings.sent4: Her overfearing of failure was like a heavy chain holding her back from pursuing her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The overfearing storm clouds loomed ominously in the sky, threatening to unleash their fury at any moment.

meanings.definition: The act of feeling excessive fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: His overfearing of public speaking made him avoid any situation where he might have to talk in front of a crowd.
meanings.sent2: The overfearing she experienced before the exam caused her hands to tremble and her heart to race.
meanings.sent3: The overfearing of spiders led her to scream and jump on the chair whenever she spotted one.
meanings.sent4: The overfearing in her eyes was evident as she hesitated to step onto the shaky bridge.
meanings.sent5: The overfearing in the room was palpable, as everyone waited nervously for the results to be announced.

meanings.definition: To have an excessive amount of fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: He was overfearing the upcoming job interview, worrying about every possible question they might ask.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overfear when flying, gripping the armrest tightly during takeoff and landing.
meanings.sent3: The overfearing in his voice was evident as he described the encounter with the wild bear.
meanings.sent4: Her overfearing of rejection prevented her from taking the first step towards asking her crush out.
meanings.sent5: The overfearing clouds cast a shadow over the picnic, threatening to ruin the outdoor gathering.
